pageReferences.description: The Recording domain defines methods for managing recordings.
Get a description of a recording.
Create a session for inspecting a recording. This command does not return until the recording's contents have been fully received, unless loadPoint is specified. If the contents are incom...
Release a session and allow its resources to be reclaimed.

Begin processing a recording, even if no sessions have been created for it.
After calling this, sessions created for the recording (on this connection,
or another) may start in a partially or fully pr...

Add a sourcemap to the recording.

The sourcemap will be applied to any file that matches the given
set of target hash filters.

Add original source content to a given sourcemap.

SourceMaps do not always contain the original source, so this
this allows users to explicitly associate the correct source content
with a source in t...
Describes how much of a recording's data has been uploaded to the cloud service.

Emitted during 'createSession' if all recording data has been received, but
sourcemaps are still pending.
Emitted when a session has died due to a server side problem.
Globally unique identifier for a recording.
Unique identifier for the software used to produce a recording.

A point in time within a recording, specified as the elapsed time in
milliseconds since the recording started. Sub-millisecond resolution
is possible.
Description for a range of time within a recording.

Identifier for a point within a recording at which the program state can be
inspected. Execution points are integers encoded as base-10 numeric strings,
such that smaller numbered points precede large...
A range between two execution points in a recording.

An execution point and its associated time stamp. Recordings always have a
beginning execution point with value "0" and a time stamp of zero.
A range between two points, with associated time stamps.
A mouse event that occurs somewhere in a recording.
Kinds of mouse events described in a recording.
A keyboard event that occurs somewhere in a recording.

Kinds of keyboard events described in a recording.
Note: Platforms should prefer to record key down/up events if possible, but keypress
is provided as a simpler fallback for platforms unable to track ...
A navigate operation that occurs somewhere in a recording.
An annotation that was added to a recording.
An opaque source map identifier.

The hash of a target for the sourcemap.

See Resource.FileHash for further info in the expected format for
this hash string.
The commands for uploading and processing resource files.
Get the token to use when computing the hashes of a given file.

An opaque salt value that can be used to create a Proof for a file.

This string should be prepended to the file's content when calculating
the file's salted hash for the Proof.
Check if a given resource already exists on our servers.
Upload a file, and for ease of use, get a resource proof for it.

A string representing hashed resource file content.

All hashes should be computed with SHA256 and prefixed with "sha256:"
All hashes should be computed using the UTF8 encoding of their content.
All h...
An object representing knowledge of a file's full content.
The Authentication domain defines a command for authenticating the current user.
Set the user's current access token
The Session domain defines methods for using recording sessions. In order to inspect a recording, it must first be loaded into a session via Recording.createSession. After the session is...
Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, missingRegions and unprocessedRegions events will be periodically emitted. Commands which require in...
Find all points in the recording at which a mouse move or click occurred. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, mouseEvents events will be periodically...
Find all points in the recording at which a keyboard event occurred. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, keyboardEvents events will be periodically e...

Find all points in the recording at which an annotation was added via the
RecordReplayOnAnnotation driver API. Does not return until the recording
is fully processed. Before returning, <code>annotatio...
Get the different kinds of annotations in the recording.
Get the last execution point in the recording.
Get a point near a given time in the recording.
Create a pause describing the state at an execution point.
Release a pause and allow its resources to be reclaimed.
Listen for changes in the loading status of parts of the recording. Does not return until the session has been released. Before returning, loadedRegions events will be emitted when their ...

Request that an unloaded part of the recording start loading.

After this command returns, any future commands that are sent will use the
new loading set of regions, and might need to wait until they ...
Request that part of the recording be unloaded. As for Session.loadRegion, the newly loaded regions will take effect after the command returns, and commands which are sent before this ret...
Get the identifier of the build used to produce the recording.
Event describing regions of the recording that have not been uploaded.
Event describing regions of the recording that have not been processed.
Describes some mouse events that occur in the recording.
Describes some keyboard events that occur in the recording.
Describes some navigate events that occur in the recording.
Describes some annotations in the recording.
Describes the regions of the recording which are loading or loaded.
Placeholder event for metrics being emitted.

An event indicating that something happened in a way that is not yet officially
supported in the protocol. This will only be emitted for sessions which
specified experimental settings when they were c...
Unique identifier for a session which a recording has been loaded into.
Level at which a recording can be processed. After basic processing, all console messages, sources, paints, and mouse events will be available immediately.

The Graphics domain defines methods for accessing a recording's graphics data.

All commands and events in this domain must include a sessionId.
Find all points in the recording at which paints occurred. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, paintPoints events will be periodically emitted. The u...
Get the playback video data for this session. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, playbackVideoFragment events will be periodically emitted. The con...
Get the graphics at a point where a paint occurred.
Get the value of window.devicePixelRatio. This is the ratio of pixels in screen shots to pixels used by DOM/CSS data such as DOM.getBoundingClientRect.

Describes some points in the recording at which paints occurred. No paint
will occur for the recording's beginning execution point.

Describes the next fragment of playback video data, as part of the response
to the getPlaybackVideo request.
Graphics encoding format.
Compact hash code for a screen shot.
Compact description of the graphics rendered at some point.
Complete contents of the graphics rendered at some point.
Information about a point where a paint occurred.

The Debugger domain defines methods for accessing sources in the recording and navigating around the recording using breakpoints, stepping, and so forth.

All commands and events in this domai...
Find all sources in the recording. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, newSource events will be emitted for every source in the recording.
Get the contents of a source.
Get the sourcemap of a source.

Get a compact representation of the locations where breakpoints can be set
in a region of a source.

Get a HitCount object for each of the given locations in the given sourceId.
Counts will only be computed for regions in the recording which are loaded.
Get the number of times handlers for a type of event executed.
Get the mapped location for a source location.
Set a breakpoint at a location.
Remove a breakpoint.
Find where to pause when running forward from a point.
Find where to pause when rewinding from a point.
Find where to pause when reverse-stepping from a point.
Find where to pause when stepping from a point.

Find where to pause when stepping from a point and stopping at the entry of
any encountered call.
Find where to pause when stepping out from a frame to the caller.
Blackbox a source or a region in it. Resume commands like findResumeTarget will not return execution points in blackboxed regions of a source.
Unblackbox a source or a region in it.
Get the function names that match a query.
Describes a source in the recording.
Unique ID for a source.

Kind of a source.

inlineScript: Inline contents of a script element.
scriptSource: Script loaded via the src attribute of a scr...
Possible content types for sources.

A combination of a location and the number of times that location was hit
during the execution of the currently loaded regions.
Type of an event which handlers can be associated with.
Location within a particular source.
Set of locations which are all on the same line of the same source.
Location within a source.

A location in a generated source, along with corresponding locations in any
original sources which the generated source was source mapped from.
The generated location is the first element of the array...
ID for a breakpoint.

Reasons why execution can pause when running forward or backward through the recording.

endpoint: Ran to the beginning or end of the recording.
breakpoint: Hit a...
Description of an execution point.

Description of a point where execution can pause after running forward or
backward through the recording.

Identifier for a JS object that persists through the lifetime of that object,
unlike Pause.ObjectId which can use different IDs for the same JS object in
different pauses.

The Console domain defines methods for accessing messages reported to the console.

All commands and events in this domain must include a sessionId.
Find all messages in the recording. Does not return until the recording is fully processed. Before returning, newMessage events will be emitted for every console message in the recording.

Find all messages in one area of a recording. Useful if finding all messages in
the recording overflowed.
Describes a console message in the recording.
Contents of a console message.
Possible sources from which a message can originate.
Severity level of a message.

The Pause domain is used to inspect the state of the program when it is paused at particular execution points.

All commands and events in this domain must include both a sessionId

Evaluate an expression in the context of a call frame. This command is
effectful.
Evaluate an expression in a global context. This command is effectful.
Read a property from an object. This command is effectful.
Call a function object. This command is effectful.
Read a property from an object, then call the result. This command is effectful.
Load a preview for an object.
Load a scope's contents.
Get the topmost frame on the stack.
Get all frames on the stack.
Get the values of a frame's arguments.

Get the points of all steps that are executed by a frame.

If this is a generator frame then steps from all places where the frame
executed will be returned, except in parts of the recording are unloa...
Get any exception that is being thrown at this point.

Unique identifier for a pause session where the program state can be inspected.
Pauses are each associated with a specific execution point, and when created
reflect the program state when it reached t...
Identifier for a call frame in a pause.

Description of the entire call stack: the IDs of all frames, in order
starting with the topmost (currently executing) frame.
Identifier for a scope in a pause.
Identifier for a JS object in a pause.
Description of a value. At most one property will be specified. If no properties are specified, the value is undefined.
Description of a value, with an associated name.
Description of a stack frame.
Different kinds of stack frames.
Description of a scope.
Possible types of a scope.
Description of an object.
Description of some or all of an object's contents.
Description of an object's own property. The NamedValue members indicate the property's name and its value if it is a data descriptor.
Compact bitmask of configuration flags on a property. Possible values in the mask are 1 (whether the property is writable), 2 (whether the property is configurable), 4<...
An entry in a container object (maps, sets, weak maps, and weak sets).
The possible states for a promise.
The internal state data of a promise.
The internal state data of a proxy.

Block of data from this pause which might be useful to the protocol client.
To reduce the number of back-and-forth calls required over the protocol,
data which wasn't specifically asked for can be ret...
Result of performing an effectful operation.

Levels of detail for an object preview.

none: Don't actually generate a preview, but just an Object with non-preview information.
noProperties: Ge...

The DOM domain is used to inspect the DOM at particular execution points. Inspecting the DOM requires a Pause.PauseId, and DOM nodes are identified by a Pause.ObjectId.
...
Get the page's root document.

Load previews for an object and its transitive parents up to the
root document.
Call querySelector() on a node in the page.
Get the event listeners attached to a node in the page.
Get boxes for a node.
Get the bounding client rect for a node.
Get the bounding client rect for all elements on the page.
Search the DOM for nodes containing a string.

Paint the state of the DOM at this pause, even if no equivalent paint
occurred when originally recording. In the latter case a best-effort attempt
will be made to paint the current graphics, but the r...
Description of an event listener on a page.
Description of a node's contents which is attached to its associated Pause.ObjectPreview.node.
Description of an element attribute.
Type of a pseudo element.
Description of the box model for a node.
Compact representation of an array of DOMQuads, projected onto the x/y plane (i.e. z and w values in points are ignored). Each quad is 8 elements, with the
Compact representation of a DOMRect. A rect has four elements, listing the rect's left, top, right, and bottom values in order.

Clipping bounds that are applied to an element. These come from an ancestor
element that has the CSS overflow property set. Bounds that have no effect
on the element are left out.
Describes the bounding client rect for a node.

The CSS domain is used to inspect the CSS state at particular execution points.

All commands and events in this domain must include both a sessionId and a pauseId.
Get the styles computed for a node.
Get the style rules being applied to a node.
A style which is applied to a node.
Information about a rule applied to a node.
Description of a CSSRule's contents which is attached to its associated Pause.ObjectPreview.rule.
Description of a CSSStyleDeclaration's contents which is attached to its associated Pause.ObjectPreview.style.
Information about a style property declaration.
Description of a StyleSheet's contents which is attached to its associated Pause.ObjectPreview.styleSheet.
Location of a rule within an original style sheet.

The Analysis domain is used to efficiently analyze the program state at many
execution points. Analysis specifications are based on the MapReduce
algorithm: a map operation is performed on all the exe...
Start specifying a new analysis.
Apply the analysis to every point where a source location executes.
Apply the analysis to every function entry point in a region of a source.
Apply the analysis to a random selection of points.
Apply the analysis to the entry point of every handler for an event.
Apply the analysis to every point where an exception is thrown.
Apply the analysis to a specific set of points.
Run the analysis. After this is called, analysisResult and/or analysisError events will be emitted as results are gathered. Does not return until the analysis has finished an...
Release an analysis and its server side resources. If the analysis is running, it will be canceled, preventing further analysisResult and analysisError events from being emit...
Find the set of execution points at which an analysis will run. After this is called, analysisPoints events will be emitted as the points are found. Does not return until events for all p...
Describes some results of an analysis.

Describes an error that occurred when running an analysis mapper or reducer
function. This will not be emitted for every error, but if there was any
error then at least one event will be emitted.
Describes some points at which an analysis will run.
Unique identifier for an analysis.
Input to the mapper function.

Key for an analysis result. This can be any JSON value. Keys are equivalent
if they are structurally equivalent: they have the same contents, though
object keys may be ordered differently when stringi...
Value for an analysis result. This can be any JSON value.
A key/value pair produced by an analysis.

The Network domain is used to inspect the Network state at particular execution points.

All commands and events in this domain must include both a sessionId.

Query the recording for all of the parts of this request body.
The server will emit 'requestBodyData' events for all parts, and
this command will not complete until all parts have been sent.

Query the recording for all of the parts of this response body.
The server will emit 'responseBodyData' events for all parts, and
this command will not complete until all parts have been sent.

Query the recording for all network data that is available, returning once
all 'Network.requests' events have been dispatched.

Emit data about a request body as it is processed.
Parts are not guaranteed to be emitted in order.
A piece of data from the request body.

Emit data about a response body as it is processed.
Parts are not guaranteed to be emitted in order.
A piece of data from the response body.

Describe some requests that were dispatched by the recording.

NOTE: There is no guarantee that request information will be available
before the request event info, so all temporal combinations should...
The string id of a request.
The range offsets within a request/response body.

A piece of request/response data. Currently only base64-encoded
binary data, but may be expanded in the future to handle
websockets and other data stream types.
The basic information about a request.
The basic information about events emitted by a request.
An HTTP header key/value pair.

A tagged union type of all of the request events.
Use 'kind' to differentiate the events.
An event representing the beginning of a request.
An event representing the request having sent raw headers.
An event representing information about the request's destination.
An event representing the response to a request being received.
An event representing the response having received raw headers.

An event representing the presence of a response body for this
request, indicating a Network.getResponseBody command will not
throw an error for this request.

An event representing the presence of a request body for this
request, indicating a Network.getRequestBody command will not
throw an error for this request.
An event representing the request having completed.
An event representing the request having failed.

The Target domain includes commands that are sent by the Record Replay Driver
to the target application which it is attached to. Protocol clients should
not use this domain. See https://replay.io/driv...
Query the target for general information about what capabilities it supports.
Get the function ID / offset to use for a source location, if there is one.
Get the location to use for a function ID / offset.
Get all the locations to use for some offsets in a function. This can be implemented more efficiently by some targets than when separate convertFunctionOffsetToLocation commands are used.

Get the offsets at which execution should pause when stepping around within
a frame for a function.
Get the most complete contents known for an HTML file.
Get the IDs of all functions in a range within a source.
Get any source map URL associated with a source.
Get any source map URL associated with a style sheet.
This command might be sent from within a RecordReplayOnConsoleMessage() call to get contents of the new message. Properties in the result have the same meaning as for Console.Message.
Count the number of stack frames on the stack. This is equivalent to using the size of the stack returned by Pause.getAllFrames, but can be implemented more efficiently.

Get the IDs of the functions for all stack frames, ordered from topmost to
bottommost.

If the topmost frame on the stack is a generator frame which can be popped
and pushed on the stack repeatedly, return a unique ID for the frame which
will be consistent across each of those pops and p...
Get the location of the top frame on the stack, if there is one.

This command might be sent from within a RecordReplayOnNetworkRequestEvent()
call to get contents of the request data.
Fetch the current data entry for a given driver OnNetworkStreamData call.

This command is used, when supported by the target runtime, to collect all
possible breakpoints for all sources of a given region in one batch. This is
an optimization over sending one Debugger.getPos...
The various capabilities supported by a target.

Represents the data pieces returned from a network stream. Always "data" for now
but we'll likely add more in the future to support Websockets.

The Internal domain is for use in software that is used to create recordings
and for internal/diagnostic use cases. While use of this domain is not
restricted, it won't be very helpful for other users...
Create a new recording.

Adds metadata that is associated with the entire recording in question,
as identified by the id field in the recordingData field. This includes things
like the URL being recorded as well as the token ...

Add data to a recording. The next message sent after this must be a binary
message with the data described by this message. A response to this command
indicates that the data has been successfully rec...
Add metadata about a recording.

Indicate that all data for the given recording has been sent and the recording
can be marked ready and complete. If this is not sent, the recording will be
finished as a sideeffect of the connection c...

Lock a given recording so that sessions will not be created
until the lock has been removed.
Unlock a lock so that sessions may be created.
For testing network issues.
Report information about a crash while recording.
Metadata that can be associated with a recording.

Operations that could be considered security sensitive and is
currently targeted at times when the recording accesses existing
information from the user's profile like cookies and local storage.
